meanings.definition: A name used by one group of people to refer to another group of people.
meanings.sent1: In history class, we learned about the exonym 'Vikings' for the ancient Norse people.
meanings.sent2: The exonym 'Germans' is commonly used to describe the people from Germany.
meanings.sent3: My friend thought it was funny to come up with silly exonyms for our classmates.
meanings.sent4: The exonym 'Big Apple' for New York City always intrigued me.
meanings.sent5: The exonym 'Land of the Rising Sun' for Japan is quite poetic.

meanings.definition: A name of a geographical location used by outsiders.
meanings.sent1: When traveling, it's interesting to hear the exonym 'City of Love' for Paris.
meanings.sent2: Tourists often refer to the exonym 'The Windy City' when talking about Chicago.
meanings.sent3: I chuckled when I heard the exonym 'Sin City' for Las Vegas.
meanings.sent4: The exonym 'Pearl of the Orient' for Hong Kong is truly fitting.
meanings.sent5: The exonym 'Emerald Isle' for Ireland paints a vivid picture in my mind.
